page.title: 06THE WORKMANS CLUB.
page.content: The workmen's club in King Oswy Drive has four rooms.It has a bar,two lounges, and a snooker room. They have a stage with a set of drums and a piano. A group plays every Sunday night. The bar has a pool table and a dartboard. To play pool you sign your initials on the blackboard and wait until it is your turn. Then you put your money in and the balls arrive down a chute. If you win you stay on and play the next person. You stay on until you get beat. Women can't come in the bar because it is for men only. There is a television for them. The snooker room has two twelve foot tables. The cellar is the place where the beer is kept. My dad takes me in sometimes on a Sunday dinner time. On Wednesday they have comittee meetings. Stephen Foreman age 11
